intro: Campanula tommasiniana, commonly known as the Tommasinian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It produces showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Campanula tommasiniana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
